trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for a class that is derived from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HierarchicalDataSourceControl"></xref> class.

Typically, when creating a new data source class for hierarchical data and an accompanying designer, you would inherit the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.HierarchicalDataSourceDesigner> class rather than implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IHierarchicalDataSourceDesigner> interface.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IHierarchicalDataSourceDesigner.Configure"></xref> method can be called.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IHierarchicalDataSourceDesigner.CanConfigure%2A> property is used by a design host, such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)], to determine whether to display a **Configure** command at design time.
`true` if the underlying data source has a configuration wizard that can be launched with <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IHierarchicalDataSourceDesigner.Configure"></xref>, otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IHierarchicalDataSourceDesigner.RefreshSchema(System.Boolean)"></xref> method can be called.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IHierarchicalDataSourceDesigner.CanRefreshSchema%2A> property is used by a design host, such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)], to determine whether to display a **Refresh Schema** command at design time.
Launches the configuration wizard for the underlying data source.
Occurs when a data source control has changed in some way that affects data-bound controls.
Gets the named data source view that is associated with the data source control.
The XPath for the part of the data source to retrieve.
The named data source view that is associated with the data source control.
Refreshes the schema of the underlying data source.
`true` to suppress events raised while refreshing the schema; otherwise `false`.
Restores events after calling the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IHierarchicalDataSourceDesigner.SuppressDataSourceEvents"></xref> method.
Occurs when the fields or data of the underlying data source have changed.
Turns off events in the data source control.
You can restore events with the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IHierarchicalDataSourceDesigner.ResumeDataSourceEvents%2A> method.
